name: Error Detection & Fault Tolerance
description: Sub-sector template for error detection patents (CPC G06F11*) including fault tolerance, ECC, RAID, and system recovery.
contextDescription: Error detection patents cover fault tolerance and reliability in computing systems. G06F11/07 covers error detection in memory, G06F11/10 covers error correction codes (ECC), G06F11/14 covers checkpoint/restart, G06F11/20 covers redundancy (RAID). Key targets include storage vendors (EMC, NetApp, Pure), memory vendors (Samsung, SK Hynix), and enterprise system vendors (IBM, HPE, Dell).
scoringGuidance: ECC memory patents (G06F11/10) are implemented in all server and enterprise memory.
RAID patents may be standards-essential or widely implemented in storage arrays.
Checkpoint/restart patents are essential for HPC and long-running workloads.
Hardware error detection patents apply to all processors and memory controllers.
Software-defined storage reliability patents target modern distributed systems.

questions.question: What error detection/correction method does this patent cover? Score: 1-3 for application-level, 4-6 for system/OS level, 7-10 for hardware-level (ECC, parity).
questions.reasoningPrompt: Hardware-level error detection is ubiquitous. Identify the detection layer.

questions.question: Does this patent apply to storage systems (RAID, SSD controllers, distributed storage)? Storage is error-critical.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Storage vendors are major implementers of error detection. Assess storage relevance.

questions.question: Does this patent address memory reliability (ECC DIMM, scrubbing, error reporting)? Memory errors are critical in servers.
questions.reasoningPrompt: All server memory uses ECC. Assess memory reliability relevance.

questions.question: Does this patent cover recovery mechanisms (checkpoint, failover, rebuild, retry)? Recovery is as important as detection.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify specific recovery mechanisms covered by this patent.
